decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using burn spells and aggressive creatures. By efficiently utilizing cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, along with creatures like Ghitu Lavarunner, the deck aims to reduce the opponent's life total as quickly as possible. Curse of the Pierced Heart helps to ensure consistent damage each turn, while cards like Fireblast provide a powerful finisher. With a low mana curve and a high concentration of burn spells, this deck's strategy revolves around overwhelming the opponent with direct damage.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Tireless Tribe card in combination with spells like Inside Out and Shadow Rift to create a powerful combo that can quickly deal a large amount of damage to the opponent. The deck also includes a variety of card draw and counterspells to help protect the combo and ensure its success. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Daze and Gitaxian Probe adds flexibility and disruption to the deck's strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying cheap artifacts and utilizing them to power up creatures like Myr Enforcer and Frogmite, while also utilizing cards like Galvanic Blast and Fling for direct damage to the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of creatures and artifacts to quickly finish the game. It also includes draw spells like Thoughtcast and Perilous Research to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent. The deck thrives on synergy between artifacts and creatures to create a fast and aggressive playstyle.

The main focus of this Pauper Aggro - Affinity deck is to quickly deploy artifact creatures such as Frogmite and Myr Enforcer using cheap artifacts like Springleaf Drum and Prophetic Prism. By utilizing cards like Temur Battle Rage, Galvanic Blast, and Fling, the deck aims to deal a lot of damage in a short amount of time. Thoughtcast and Gitaxian Probe help to draw additional cards and keep the momentum going. Carapace Forger provides a defensive option with its high toughness. Ultimately, the deck looks to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive artifact creatures and burn spells.

The core idea of this deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Elf creatures and generating card advantage with Lead the Stampede and Distant Melody. By efficiently casting multiple Elves in a turn, players can overwhelm their opponents with a swarm of creatures, backed up by powerful Elf synergies like Timberwatch Elf and Lys Alana Huntmaster. The deck aims to build a wide board presence while also gaining life through Wellwisher, creating a consistent and aggressive pressure against opponents in Pauper 1 vs 1 matches.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature plays, utilizing cards like Thraben Inspector, Kor Skyfisher, and Glint Hawk to quickly build a strong board presence. The deck also features efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Journey to Nowhere to clear the path for attacking creatures. Additionally, there are cards like Battle Screech and Palace Sentinels to generate additional value and maintain card advantage. The mana base is optimized for consistent early game plays and the inclusion of artifact-based cards like Prophetic Prism and Alchemist's Vial helps with card draw and mana fixing.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by assembling the Urzatron lands to generate a large amount of mana. It utilizes cards like Mystical Teachings, Negate, and Prohibit to counter threats, while also gaining card advantage with Mulldrifter and Prophetic Prism. The deck has a mix of removal, card draw, and recursion to out-value the opponent and eventually win the game with powerful spells like Rolling Thunder. It is a patient and strategic deck that aims to outlast the opponent and overpower them with its late-game threats.

This deck focuses on using low-cost aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Faerie Miscreant to apply early pressure on the opponent. Ninja of the Deep Hours allows for card advantage and tempo swings, while Spellstutter Sprite provides disruptive counterspells. The deck also includes removal in the form of Skred and Lightning Bolt to deal with threatening creatures. The mana base is designed for consistency and includes cantrips like Ponder and Preordain to ensure the deck can find the necessary cards to win the game.

The deck focuses on a combo revolving around Tireless Tribe, utilizing cards like Shadow Rift, Inside Out, and various cantrips to draw through the deck quickly and enable a lethal attack. The deck also includes disruption spells like Dispel and Circular Logic to protect the combo and interact with the opponent. The mana base is fine-tuned for consistency with Evolving Wilds and Ash Barrens, allowing for smooth mana fixing. Augur of Bolas provides additional card selection and helps find key combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to execute its combo plan efficiently while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay, using cards like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast to deal direct damage to the opponent while deploying efficient creatures like Kor Skyfisher and Glint Hawk. The deck also includes cards like Journey to Nowhere for removal and Prophetic Prism for card draw and fixing mana. The strategy revolves around maintaining board presence and pressuring the opponent with a mix of direct damage and efficient creatures, ultimately aiming to overwhelm the opponent before they can set up their own game plan.

This deck relies on a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful instant spells to control the board and overwhelm the opponent. By efficiently countering threats and digging for key cards, it sets the stage for a quick victory with the help of evasive creatures like Ninja of the Deep Hours and Delver of Secrets. The inclusion of card draw and tempo plays like Gush and Brainstorm allows for consistent pressure and disruption, making it a versatile and adaptable archetype in the Pauper format.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently control the game by assembling the Urzatron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana. This mana is then used to cast powerful spells such as Lightning Bolt, Rolling Thunder, and Ulamog's Crusher to deal damage or control the board. The deck also focuses on card draw and filtering with Ancient Stirrings, Mulldrifter, and Prophetic Prism to maintain a steady stream of threats and answers. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with superior resources and card advantage.

The deck focuses on small, efficient creatures like Faerie Miscreant, Delver of Secrets, and Augur of Bolas to control the board early on and apply pressure. By countering spells with cards like Counterspell and Spellstutter Sprite, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while protecting its own creatures. Ninja of the Deep Hours allows for card advantage and tempo plays, while burn spells like Skred and Lightning Bolt provide reach and removal. The deck combines elements of aggro and midrange to create a flexible and powerful game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly play creatures like Nivix Cyclops and Kiln Fiend, then pump them up with spells like Temur Battle Rage and Mutagenic Growth to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck focuses on using cantrips like Preordain and Ponder to draw into the right spells, while also including disruption spells like Dispel and Daze to protect your creatures. The inclusion of cards like Gitaxian Probe and Augur of Bolas help gain card advantage and maintain pressure on the opponent, ultimately aiming to win the game as quickly as possible.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Urzatron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a significant amount of mana to cast powerful spells and control the game. The deck includes cards like Mulldrifter, Mnemonic Wall, and Dinrova Horror to draw cards, recur spells, and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing efficient mana ramp, card draw, and control elements, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent until it can establish a dominant board presence and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the combination of Tireless Tribe and Inside Out to quickly win the game. By cycling through cards with Ponder, Preordain, and Brainstorm, the deck aims to find the necessary pieces to execute the combo efficiently. Augur of Bolas helps to dig for combo pieces while providing a blocker against aggressive decks. Circular Logic and Dispel are used for protection, while Gush and Gigadrowse provide additional card advantage and disruption. The deck aims to assemble the combo and win the game as quickly as possible.
